page.title: 10The Church at Coll.Kingston
page.content: St. Mary's Church at Collingbourne Kingston founded in Norman times contains an early English Chancel and has a perpendicular tower. The memorials include a 17th century canopied tomb and 19th and 20th century stained glass windows. The latest of these dedicated in l985 contrasts sharply with the other windows. Here the design is based on abstract ideas of the ministry. In spite of the decline in attendance the church is actively used for weddings, baptisms and funeral services. Unfortunately, at the present time, there is no choir but the six bells, the oldest dating from 1641, have been rung on special occasions since the tower was built. This makes bell_ringing the only secular church activity to have survived the centuries.
